1.title: Stone of Destiny, the Day Niagara Falls Shuts Off, the Madness of Mary
1.plot: Don visits a famous London church that set the stage for an audacious heist; a natural wonder that Mother Nature herself threatened to shut down; and a prison that once housed a famous first lady.

2.title: Freedom Balloon, First Film Star, Therapy Dog
2.plot: Don examines a barrier that gave rise to one of history's most daring escapes; gazes upon a star that honors a founding figure of Hollywood's celebrity culture; and admires the statue of a pioneering psychiatrist who inspired another lifesaving type of therapy.

3.title: Harlem Hellfighters, Resurrected Jockey, Braille
3.plot: Host Don Wildman heads to Harlem to view a memorial dedicated to World War I heroes, ventures to a California racetrack where a jockey beats death, and travels to the Pantheon in Paris to pay respect to a great man.

4.title: Savior of the Squalus
4.plot: Host Don Wildman examines a memorial honoring a historic vessel that endured a maritime nightmare; investigates the ingenuity behind an iconic structure in Italy; and explores a German park that marks a sweet tale of a war hero.

5.title: Pretender Prince, American Lunch, Lie Factory
5.plot: Host Don Wildman investigates a prison fortress in London that inspired a risky bid for the throne of England, examines a sculpture honoring civil rights, and tells the tale of a novelist who was the target of a smear campaign.

6.title: The Real Q, Alibi Clock, Sasquatch in a Shelf
6.plot: Host Don Wildman visits Britain's MI6 where spymasters groomed a gadget genius, views a California clocktower that was key in absolving a man accused of terrorism, and visits a quirky monument honoring a mythical turtle.

7.title: Piggy Bank, All the Kings' Horses, Funeral to Freedom
7.plot: A simple plaques that pays salute to a young boy and his pig; explores a medieval tower that allegedly inspired a beloved children's verse; and recalls an audacious flight to freedom during a visit to a historic grave.

8.title: Pickles Saves the World Cup, Strowger Switch, Rebel Rose
8.plot: Host Don Wildman heads to London to see a statue that marks an unforgettable moment in British sporting history, visits the tomb of a man whose grudge inspired innovation, and visits a Civil War battle site altered by a vandal.

9.title: Black Magic, Tobacco Heir, Everest Disaster
9.plot: Host Don Wildman heads to sunny Pasadena to explore the mysterious death of renowned scientist, investigate the murder of gaudy heir and his celebrity wife, and probe the true story behind one of Mt. Everest's deadliest disasters.

10.title: Stockholm Syndrome, Soviet Who Saved the World, Barbara Rose
10.plot: Host Don Wildman visits a plaza in Sweden that was at the center of an infamous heist, examines a monument in Florida that recalls a near-catastrophic war, and honors a Virginia activist who fought for equal education rights.

11.title: Gunpowder Plot, Yellowstone, Cops Are Robbers
11.plot: Host Don Wildman examines the 17th century plot that threatened Parliament, treks to a Wyoming mountain to uncover the true story that inspired America's first national park, and visits a Massachusetts night deposit box.

12.title: The Disaster That Saved London, the Man in the Green Hat, the Viking Mailman
12.plot: Don Wildman visits London where a tall column memorializes a tragic event, then travels to the Capitol Building in Washington D.C., where a hypocrisy was exposed, and travels to Genoa, Nevada to view a monument to a frontiersman.

13.title: Lady Godiva & the Peeping Tom, Bishop's Brain, Birds of a Feather
13.plot: Host Don Wildman treks to Coventry, UK, to view a statue that tells a story of bravery, heads to a Brooklyn cemetery to uncover the death of a psychic, and ventures to the Everglades to check out birds that fueled a fashion trend.

1.title: Teen Vampire, King of Cons, First Escape from Alcatraz
1.plot: Don Wildman examines a tombstone of a young woman who some say haunted a small New England town, exposes the man behind one of New York City's most elaborate and historic scams, and visits the country's most infamous prison.

2.title: Sickness of Brooklyn Bridge, Day the Sky Fell Down, Gram Parsons Coffin Heist
2.plot: Host Don Wildman visits an iconic bridge, examines a twisted and beautiful marble sculpture that commemorates and out-of-this world event, and heads to a vast desert landscape to investigate the last days of a legendary rock star.

3.title: Smoky the Yorkie, Golden Gate Bridge, Oakville Blobs
3.plot: Host Don Wildman visits the memorial to the dog that became a celebrated war hero, examines the iconic bridge shrouded in tragedy, and heads to the state forest where a unidentified substance threatened an entire community.

4.title: Grand Central Occult, Superhero Surfer, Charleston Jail
4.plot: Host Don Wildman explores the strange occult imagery on the ceiling of New York's most famous train station, examines the exiting life of the father of modern daysurfing, and visits the grim chambers of a haunted prison.

5.title: Chrysler Building, Stanford Mausoleum, Hedy Lamarr
5.plot: Host Don Wildman visits one of New York City's most iconic sky scrapers and the epicenter of a bitter rivalry, explores an unsolved murder mystery, and examines the spot where a film legend contributions to science and technology.

6.title: Ellis Island, Sailing Stones, Alamo Treasure
6.plot: Host Don Wildman visits a 27-acre island one mile from Lower Manhattan , examines a mysterious set of stones, and heads to a legendary 300-year-old fortress.

7.title: The Real Rocky, Dr. Burdell, Kissing Sailor
7.plot: Don Wildman visits a memorial to a fictional boxing legend, travels to the tombstones of a murdered dentist and the 'black widow', and examines a monument to an iconic moment of public affection.

8.title: Sleeping Prophet, Mysterious Death of Mozart, the Real Poltergeist
8.plot: Don Wildman visits the grave marker of a mysterious psychic, examines a bust of one the greatest composers of all time, and explores a city park that is haunted by a sinister episode from its past.

9.title: American Venus, Alien Abduction, Buffalo Wings
9.plot: Don Wildman examines a set of statues that represent a muse whose beauty inspired a crime of passion, visits a forest that was the site of a possibly abduction and explores a city to track down a creator.

10.title: Devil's Music, Fisherman's Wharf, Alaska Triangle Hale Boggs
10.plot: Don Wildman visits the spot where a legendary bluesman made a deal with the devil, examines a city wharf that lead to a case of fraud, and explores the National Forest where two of the country's most powerful men vanished .

11.title: First Circus Elephant, Greenbrier Ghost, Death of Captain Cook
11.plot: Don Wildman visits a monument to the first circus elephant, looks at a tombstone of a young woman whose ghost allegedly helped convict her husband of murder, and examines a statue of a explorer who met a violent demise.

12.title: Eureka Springs Cancer Hotel, Female Paul Revere, Frozen Grandpa
12.plot: Don Wildman visits a landmark town where a con man preyed on desperate cancer patients, examines a statue of a teenage girl on horseback, and looks inside a storage shed that has inspired media frenzies and legal battles.

13.title: Ames Pyramid, Straus Titanic, Cracking the Zodiac
13.plot: Don Wildman examines a strange pyramid, visits a statue that commemorates a love story, and explores an island nicknamed for a California serial killer.

1.title: Lucy the Elephant, Capitol Bomber, Hitler in Hollywood
1.plot: Host Don Wildman gazes upon a majestic mammoth that boasts an incredible tale of survival; investigates an iconic landmark that was at the center of a terrifying chain of explosive attacks; and unveils an abandoned camp.

2.title: St. Urho; Mystery Castle; Bat Bombs
2.plot: Host Don Wildman investigates a sculpture of a suspicious saint with a dubious past; visits a fortress at the center of a strange tale of secrecy, discovery, and death; and explores spectacular caverns and its multitude of bats.

3.title: Headless Chicken, Boon Island, Sister Aimee
3.plot: Host Don Wildman examines an unusual sculpture of a death-defying creature; gazes upon a lonely outpost built atop an island that witnessed unspeakable horrors; and explores a spectacular park linked to a preacher.

4.title: Sacred Cod, Forgotten Hero, Artichoke War
4.plot: Host Don Wildman investigates the fishy disappearance of a sacred effigy; explores the truth behind the first African-American baseball player; and examines the statue of a New York mayor.

5.title: Captain Thunderbolt, Newsboys, Rocket Man
5.plot: Host Don Wildman unmasks the mysterious former scholar of the Round Schoolhouse in Brookline Vermont; explores the David and Goliath tale of New York's newsboys; and explores a life-sized bronze statue of a pioneering explorer.

6.title: Kecksburg Acorn, Skyscraper Swindle, US Emperor
6.plot: A giant acorn commemorates a 1965 UFO incident in Kecksburg, Pennsylvania. A signpost in Martinsburg, West Virginia marks the spot of the Belle Boyd Home, belonging to a Confederate spy who killed a Union soldier. The world's littlest skyscraper in Wichita Falls, Texas - the center of an oil boom investment scheme. Haunted Mission San Miguel Arcángel in Paso Robles, California holds the horrors of a gold rush massacre. The San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge - inspired by eccentric "Emperor of the U.S." Joshua Norton. A statue of a Holocaust hero: Japanese diplomat ...

7.title: The King and the Spanish Dancer; a Communist Comes to America; Filth Party
7.plot: Host Don Wildman explores the former home of a mysterious dancer that cost a Bavarian king his home; a 16 foot statue of Vladimir Lenin; and investigates a disease once studied by a scientist who used himself as a lab rat.

8.title: Superman vs. The KKK; Who Killed Huey Long?; Marches to Montgomery
8.plot: Host Don Wildman explores a colossal mountain where a hero in disguise took on the KKK; investigates the grave of politician Huey Long; and takes in a bridge that found itself at the center of the struggle for civil rights.

9.title: The Reanimator; Florida Three Toes; the Man Who Invented Martians
9.plot: Host Don Wildman explores the University of California at Berkley where a scientist once tried to play god; investigates the tale of a Godzilla like creature; and explains an observatory's namesake changed our perception of life.

10.title: Blind Tom; Invention of the Tommy Gun; Granddaddy of Snowboarding
10.plot: Host Don Wildman explores the grave of a blind slave who's musical talents led to a custody battle; investigates the birthplace of the inventor of the Tommy Gun; and investigates the origins of the snowboard.

11.title: Escape from Slavery; a Witch on Hatteras Island; the Horn That Made a Big Bang
11.plot: Host Don Wildman explores an historic home in Boston involved in one of the most audacious escapes from slavery; investigates a oak tree linked to stories of witchcraft; and marvels at an antenna that changed our lives.

12.title: The House That Sugar Built; Kill Dozer; Rocking Chair Riots
12.plot: Host Don Wildman explores a mansion in Michigan that was built on the back of the sweetest of swindles; investigates a town terrorized by a mechanical monster; and learns of a violent uprising in NYC's Central Park.

13.title: Roosevelt's Moroccan Mission; the Last Bare Knuckle Boxer; America's First Spy Ring
13.plot: Host Don Wildman explores a battleship linked to tales of conspiracy and lies ; examines the marker that salutes the last bare knuckle boxing match; investigates the former home of the brains behind U.S. first spy ring.

-1.title: Freedom Balloon, First Film Star, Freud's Therapy Dog
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Monumental Mysteries scours the country for America's most extraordinary monuments and reveals the amazing mysteries hidden. From New York's iconic Chrysler Building that was once the site of a stunning display of an architectural chicanery, to a huge clock on the island of Hawaii where the hands are forever frozen in time, these are just some of the tales revealed. This series visits the statues, memorials, national parks, gravestones and sculptures which commemorate our nation's most notorious crimes, scandals, disasters and intriguing events of all time.
imdb.title: Mysteries at the Monument
plot: Monumental Mysteries scours the country for America's most extraordinary monuments and reveals the amazing mysteries hidden. From New York's iconic Chrysler Building that was once the site of a stunning display of an architectural chicanery, to a huge clock on the island of Hawaii where the hands are forever frozen in time, these are just some of the tales revealed. This series visits the statues, memorials, national parks, gravestones and sculptures which commemorate our nation's most notorious crimes, scandals, disasters and intriguing events of all time.::Travel Channel
